text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Transportation
			 of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion

Transportation
				of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion

text.#text:
In
				this section—

term.#tail: means a law in force in the State in which a minor resides—
term.#text: law requiring parental involvement in a minor’s abortion decision

text.#text: the term

that requires,
				before an abortion is performed on the minor—

notification to,
				or consent of, a parent of the minor; or

judicial
				authorization from a State court; and

that does not
				provide as an alternative to the requirements described in

notification to,
				or consent of, an individual who is not a parent of the minor; or

authorization
				from an entity that is not a State court;
the term

a parent or
				guardian;

a legal
				custodian; or

an individual
				standing in loco parentis who has care and control of a minor, with whom the
				minor regularly resides, and who is designated by a law requiring parental
				involvement in the minor's abortion decision as an individual to whom
				notification, or from whom consent, is required;

term.#tail:
means an individual who is not older than the maximum age
				requiring parental notification or consent, or judicial authorization from a
				State court, under a law requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion
				decision; and

text.#text: the term

term.#tail:
includes the District of Columbia and any commonwealth,
				possession, or other territory of the United States.

text.#text: the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, whoever knowingly transports a minor across a
				State line, with the intent that the minor obtain an abortion, and thereby in
				fact abridges the right of a parent of the minor under a law requiring parental
				involvement in a minor's abortion decision, shall be fined under this title or
				imprisoned not more than 1 year, or both.

text.#text:
Except
				as provided in

For
				purposes of this subsection, an abridgement of the right of a parent of a minor
				occurs if an abortion is performed on the minor, in a State other than the
				State in which the minor resides, without the parental consent or notification,
				or the judicial authorization, that would have been required under a law
				requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision, had the abortion
				been performed in the State where the minor resides.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not apply
				in the case of an abortion that is necessary to save the life of a minor
				because her life is endangered by a physical disorder, physical injury, or
				physical illness, including a life-endangering physical condition caused by or
				arising from the pregnancy itself.

text.#text: The prohibition under

A minor transported in violation of this section, and any
				parent of the minor, may not be prosecuted or sued for a violation of this
				section, a conspiracy to violate this section, or an offense under section 2 or
				3 based on a violation of this section.

It is an affirmative defense to a prosecution for an
				offense, or to a civil action, based on a violation of this section that the
				defendant reasonably believed, based on information the defendant obtained
				directly from a parent of the minor or other compelling facts, that before the
				minor obtained the abortion, the parental consent or notification, or judicial
				authorization, that would have been required under the law requiring parental
				involvement in a minor's abortion decision, had the abortion been performed in
				the State where the minor resides, took place.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may obtain appropriate relief in a civil action, unless the parent has
				committed an act of incest with the minor who was transported in violation of

text.#text: Any parent who suffers harm from a violation of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, whoever
				has committed an act of incest with a minor and knowingly transports the minor
				across a State line with the intent that the minor obtain an abortion, shall be
				fined under this title or imprisoned not more than 1 year, or
				both.

text.#text: Notwithstanding

Transportation
				of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to incest

Transportation
				of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion

text.#text: The table of chapters for

level-header.#text:
Transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws
				  relating to
				  abortion

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit taking
		  minors across State lines in circumvention of laws requiring the involvement of
		  parents in abortion decisions.
